laboratory_examinations.findings: Complete conduction block proximal to the head of the fibula of the right peroneal nerve, a partial conduction block of the left ulnar nerve between the axilla and elbow, and a suspected partial motor conduction block of the left peroneal nerve distal of the head of the fibula.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Electrophysiologic studies showed disease progression with complete conduction block of the right peroneal and left ulnar nerve and partial conduction block of the left peroneal nerve.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Testing for anti-GM1 antibodies (IgM and IgG) was negative. Immunoelectrophoresis of serum failed to detect a monoclonal protein in the /H9253-globulin fraction.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeated testing for anti-GM1 antibodies and other antiganglioside antibodies was negative.

laboratory_examinations.findings: B-cell count decreased from 18% in 2000 to 3% in 2004; other hematologic values remained normal with no observed neutropenia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The B-cell count decreased over time.
